{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:11.840
    | text      = I now admit that the Private Lynch thing really wasn't a rescue.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:14.279
    | text      = It was totally staged.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:15.440
    | text      = The Iraqis had been gone for two days.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:17.879
    | text      = The doctors had walked down the road and told them days before to come get her.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:23.159
    | text      = The special forces hours before the raid had been across the street.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:28.480
    | text      = They knew the area was deserted.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:30.039
    | text      = Turns out it was theater, Hollywood.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:31.879
    | text      = So for the last few days here in 2003, Alex has been touching on this story of the alleged
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:36.360
    | text      = rescue of Private Lynch, and I've been waiting for him to dig into it with some real depth
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:40.360
    | text      = so I can get a better sense of his exact position, but it doesn't seem like there's much here
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:44.320
    | text      = past what he said in that clip.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:46.639
    | text      = His position is that the rescue is all just Hollywood theatrics and nothing more.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:50.799
    | text      = The story of Private Lynch is actually a fantastic example of the precise problem with what Alex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:55.159
    | text      = Jones does for a living and how easy it is to get seduced into his way of thinking.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:59.840
    | text      = For some background, on March 23, 2003, Lynch's convoy was ambushed outside Nasirah in Iraq
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:06.879
    | text      = and she was taken hostage.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:08.679
    | text      = Eleven of the other members of her group were killed in the ambush and Lynch was taken to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:11.960
    | text      = nearby Saddam Hospital.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:13.960
    | text      = There she was treated and on the evening of April 1st, she was rescued by US forces.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:18.799
    | text      = From this point forward, the story is one of complete malpractice by the media where
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:22.899
    | text      = sensationalism led coverage of the story.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:25.720
    | text      = Unnamed sources claimed that she'd been shot or stabbed, but conflicting reports came out
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:29.559
    | text      = from her doctors who said that she had no such wounds.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:32.700
    | text      = Even as media outlets ran with a sensationalized version of the story, other outlets were digging
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:36.960
    | text      = in to sort out what was and was not the truth.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:40.700
    | text      = By April 15th, outlets like the Washington Post were beginning to critically examine
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:44.500
    | text      = their own initial coverage and question whether their account was accurate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:48.679
    | text      = Washington Post headline, whoops, really should have done a better job on that one, our bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:53.480
    | text      = More or less, yeah, it's interesting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:55.720
    | text      = And gradually, things fell apart and the truth of the matter came forward.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:59.360
    | text      = When Lynch was taken to Saddam Hospital, she was given appropriate medical treatment and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:02.840
    | text      = when US forces arrived to rescue her, there weren't any Iraqi forces there and much of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:07.039
    | text      = the characterization of her as a Rambo-type was based on overdramatization and misstatements.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:12.000
    | text      = Now, it's absolutely true that much of the media completely fucked this story up and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:17.320
    | text      = they may have had forces that were pretty excited that they were fucking it up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:21.919
    | text      = The war in Iraq at that point was not full of good news like the Bush administration
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:27.399
    | text      = would have wanted it to be and the idea that they would try to take this story and use
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:31.519
    | text      = it for their purposes definitely seems like what they did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:35.620
    | text      = If you read the House report that investigated the flow of information about the rescue titled
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:40.000
    | text      = House Report 110-858, you can definitely see instances of members of the Department of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:45.879
    | text      = Defense giving inaccurate information about the rescue, which fed into the heroic drama
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:50.240
    | text      = that was being sold by the media.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:52.200
    | text      = Are you telling me that war-mongering politicians and their, oh, okay, you're doing this wild.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:58.399
    | text      = I'm not telling you that entirely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:00.639
    | text      = I'm not saying that definitively.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:02.360
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:03.360
    | text      = And I think that's important.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:04.359
    | text      = Yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:05.359
    | text      = Well, there's one instance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:06.720
    | text      = On April 2nd, Brigadier General Vincent Brooks, a spokesperson for CENTCOM, told a press briefing,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:12.960
    | text      = quote, there was not a firefight outside the building, I will tell you, but there were
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:16.680
    | text      = firefights outside of the building getting in and getting out.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:20.359
    | text      = That was not true, unless you take a very broad view of what getting in and getting
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:25.019
    | text      = out means.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:26.019
    | text      = Well, we started the war a couple of months ago, so there were firefights for us to get
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:31.480
    | text      = there, and then whenever she left, the war was still going on, so there were firefights
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:35.960
    | text      = when we were leaving.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:36.960
    | text      = See?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:37.960
    | text      = On April 3rd, Navy Captain Frank Thorpe was quoted in the Military Times as saying that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:41.319
    | text      = Lynch, quote, waged quite a battle prior to her capture.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:44.559
    | text      = We do have very strong indications that Jessica Lynch was not captured very easily.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:49.059
    | text      = Reports are that she fired her M-16 rifle until she had no more ammunition.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:53.319
    | text      = None of that information is accurate, but it feeds into the creation of a story out
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:56.759
    | text      = of the movies for the public to enjoy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:59.000
    | text      = Yeah, like what they did with Lynch.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:01.519
    | text      = Pat Tillman?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:02.519
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:03.519
    | text      = Tillman, that's right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:04.519
    | text      = Yeah, that was another thing that was in that House investigation, the flow of misinformation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:08.400
    | text      = surrounding that circumstance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:10.160
    | text      = Now, the thing is, those people and their statements, the Brigadier General Brooks and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:16.400
    | text      = Navy Captain Thorpe, are not necessarily the people who gave the statements unnamed to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:22.519
    | text      = the Washington Post.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:23.519
    | text      = Sure, true.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:24.519
    | text      = It's not like these people's statements, as inaccurate as they may be, are what fueled
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:31.000
    | text      = directly the media sensationalism.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:34.119
    | text      = And it would be impossible to prove this definitively, but you'd also have to be kind of naive to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:40.299
    | text      = think that it's impossible that someone within the Department of Defense wouldn't have seen
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:43.640
    | text      = the potential to spin this story for some much needed good press for the war.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:48.160
    | text      = You could have that suspicion, and you could point fingers at the media for bungling the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:52.160
    | text      = story, but if you do that, you have to be careful about where you're pointing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:56.299
    | text      = If you damn the media for their mishandling this story, you also have to credit the media
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
